results.title: Development of Chitosan/Sodium Carboxymethylcellulose Complexes to Improve the Simvastatin Release Rate: Polymer/Polymer and Drug/Polymer Interactions' Effects on Kinetic Models
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@) is a potent @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-lowering drug used to control @<m>DISEASE_Job_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007589 @@@hyper-cholesterolemia@@@ and prevent @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular diseases@@@.

results.title: Potential Impact of Subphenotyping in Pharmacologic Management of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome.
results.text_hl: Neuromuscular blocking agents, corticosteroids, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ have resulted in a mortality benefit when used in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with the @<m>DISEASE_Job_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007589 @@@hyper@@@-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ @DISEASE_Respiratory_Distress_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D012128 @@@ARDS@@@ subphenotype.

citations.NLM: Torbic H, Bulgarelli L, Deliberato RO, Duggal A. Potential Impact of Subphenotyping in Pharmacologic Management of Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome. J Pharm Pract. 2023 Jun 19;():8971900231185392. PMID: 37337327

results.title: Enhanced solubility and bioavailability of simvastatin by mechanochemically obtained complexes.
results.text_hl: Therefore, the mechanochemically synthesized complexes of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ with AG or Na2GA might have a promising future as novel formulations for @<m>DISEASE_Job_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007589 @@@hyper-cholesterolemia@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Kong R, Zhu X, Meteleva ES, Chistyachenko YS, Suntsova LP, Polyakov NE, Khvostov MV, Baev DS, Tolstikova TG, Yu J, Dushkin AV, Su W.
